posts.title: How I made this blog
posts.description: First post telling how I created this blog without a backend.
body: I've always wanted to have a blog on my portfolio to share experiences, code snippets, and more. However, whenever I considered how to implement it, I immediately envisioned a complex setup with a backend, login system, database, and the associated environment. For a portfolio, that seemed like overkill, and I was hesitant to introduce potential vulnerabilities, API concerns, and database hosting issues.

Initially, I contemplated hardcoding the blog, but I recognized that this would be a bad practice and impractical for adding new posts easily. Fortunately, I realized that I could simulate a database using JSON and insert posts directly into it. This is how I built my blog, and you can find the complete source code in the linked repository on my portfolio (link below).
